stream_context.summary: Kaze programs several overworld features for Return to Yoshi’s Island: an unlock-star door animation with new particle effects, a coin-gated cannon NPC, and discusses the cinematic storybook intro. He shows a newly finished level on real N64 hardware and notes upcoming optimisations.

development_findings.summary: Current public engine builds are on GitHub, but the Return to Yoshi’s Island branch will become open-source only after release.
development_findings.quote: This right now is not open source yet. It will be open source though, once it's done.

development_findings.summary: WaveRace 64-style water visuals are planned; Kaze believes the visual part is simple to implement.
development_findings.quote: The WaveRace 64 water physics are not difficult to implement. From what I've seen, the visuals of it at least are pretty simple.

development_findings.summary: A major optimisation is queued: switching all 4×4 matrices to 4×3, expected to be significant at this late stage.
development_findings.quote: I am going to… turn all the 4x4 matrices finally into 4x3 matrices. That will be a pretty big optimisation.

development_findings.summary: Kaze replaced Mario 64’s behaviour-loop system with a tick-based comment to save roughly two microseconds per actor, cutting wasted cache loads.
development_findings.quote: With 100 actors, that's like 200 microseconds you just throw away.

development_findings.summary: Storyboard intro concept: scene starts 3D, morphs into 2D storybook pages, then fades back to 3D island before gameplay; idea documented for team.
development_findings.quote: …and then right here, it turns into a storybook… storybook alpha overlay disappears slowly to reveal the island below it in 3D.

development_findings.summary: Memory budget for storybook images calculated (~0.5 MB uncompressed). Plan to use CI8 textures, compression, or load as separate level; about 4-7 MB ROM space remains.
development_findings.quote: We have around 4 MB left… If Redz does the compression thing, then we get like another 4 MB.

development_findings.summary: Unlock-star door re-imagined: variable number of stars orbit Mario, scaling with requirement, with pixie-dust particles; intended to replace original star animation.
development_findings.quote: All stars should do this instead, right? That looks so much better than a normal star animation.

development_findings.summary: New NPC “Corrupt Dom” (black Bob-omb) patrols near cannon and charges 200 coins for access; four behaviour states coded.
development_findings.quote: I want this to cost coins, like it's important to me that some things just cost money.

development_findings.summary: Dialogue system refactor inadvertently broke question prompts; needs off-stream fix before NPC works.
development_findings.quote: I might have just broken this. I changed a lot about dialogues.

development_findings.summary: Upcoming feature: a ‘sand form’ power-up to be implemented soon.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s motivation philosophy: work shouldn’t rely on feeling motivated; you just work.
context_findings.quote: If you need motivation, you're already fucked up. Why do you need to feel motivated to work? Are you stupid? Just work.

context_findings.summary: He recently relocated from Germany to Canada for better prospects; migration was easy as a programmer.
context_findings.quote: I'm off to Canada and to flee Germany. Germany sucks.

context_findings.summary: Streams occur 1-3 times weekly around 2 p.m. local time.
context_findings.quote: My streams are always around 2 p.m. my local time.

context_findings.summary: Kaze shares accounts (Twitter, Facebook) with collaborators and worries about potential misuse.
context_findings.quote: One day, someone who's just sharing accounts with me is gonna do some bad stuff, and I'm gonna get into trouble.

biobak.summary: Provided a storyboard of the Yoshi memory flashback and uploaded reference images during the stream.
Actively collaborates on visual decisions; Kaze notes Biobak ‘pinching’ him in chat when needed.

badub.summary: Expected to compose or retrieve music for the cinematic boat-eaten scene and other cut-scenes.
badub.quote: Oh yeah, I'm sure Badub can pull that up.

zeina.summary: Appeared in chat in a ‘bad mood’, no project-specific contribution noted this stream.

key_stories.title: Storybook Intro Breakthrough
key_stories.summary: While reviewing a fan-made Parakarry intro, Kaze imagines turning it into a hybrid 3D/2D storybook cinematic that dissolves into the playable island, fitting Yoshi’s Story aesthetics.
key_stories.challenge: Create an opening cut-scene that feels fresh yet faithful.
key_stories.process: Brain-stormed live, sketched sequence and wrote notes to share with team.
key_stories.outcome: Concept accepted; memory and compression considerations logged for implementation.
key_stories.key_quote: Imagine this is a 3D scene… then the storybook overlay disappears slowly to reveal the island below it in 3D.

key_stories.title: Reinventing the Star Door
key_stories.summary: Original Mario 64 star-door unlock felt weak. Kaze builds a new effect: required stars spawn around Mario with pixie dust, scaling inversely with count.
key_stories.challenge: Make door unlock memorable and informative.
key_stories.process: Prototyped scaling formulas, smooth-step curves, dust particles, timing tweaks.
key_stories.outcome: Visual approved; will replace standard star animation across the game.
key_stories.key_quote: All stars should do this instead, right? That looks so much better than a normal star animation.

key_stories.title: The Corrupt Bob-omb Cannon Keeper
key_stories.summary: To gate cannon usage, Kaze designs ‘Corrupt Dom,’ a patrolling Bob-omb that charges 200 coins, adding economy and narrative flavor.
key_stories.challenge: Integrate optional progression tied to coin economy.
key_stories.process: Modelled patrol logic, dialogue states; encounters broken dialogue system.
key_stories.outcome: NPC behaviour coded; dialogue bug remains for next session.
key_stories.key_quote: 200 coins and I'll let you in on my cannon.

open_questions.context: Kaze references a planned scene where a boat is eaten during a screen shake but isn’t sure how to implement it.
questions: What is the narrative purpose of the boat being eaten?
Which technical approach will be used to depict destruction on N64 hardware?
Who will handle the animation and music cues?

open_questions.context: Kaze says visuals are simple but admits not fully understanding WaveRace physics.
questions: What visual and physical features of WaveRace water are essential?
Will water affect gameplay (buoyancy, waves) or remain cosmetic?

open_questions.context: Kaze teases an upcoming ‘sand form’ but offers no details.

open_questions.topic: Progressive Music as Yoshis are Rescued
open_questions.context: Early plan to evolve music with Yoshi count is uncertain.
questions: Is dynamic layering still feasible within N64 RAM/audio limits?
How will music transitions be triggered?
Can Badub compose modular tracks to support this?
